snippet: Some call his proposals an incoherent mishmash that could hurt millions of newly insured people, but such criticism appears only to bolster his outsider status.
abstract: Health care experts question Republican nominee Donald J Trump's ideas for replacing much maligned Obamacare; say he lacks coherent alternative to current plan, which Republicans have consistently called to be repealed under conservative administration.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: Some call his proposals an incoherent mishmash that could hurt millions of newly insured people, but such criticism appears only to bolster his outsider status.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Health Care Ideas Bewilder Republican Experts
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Ideas on Health Law Baffle Experts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
